pageContext.claim: “Prescription drugs, for the first time in history -- the history of our country -- have gone down in 2018. So for last year -- just got the numbers -- for the first time in the history of our country, prescription drug prices have gone down.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump greatly overstates what happened to the consumer price index for prescription drugs. It fell by 0.6 percent for the 12 months ending Dec. 2018, the first time in 46 years, not "the first time in history." Moreover, the Bureau of Labor Statistics says there are other 12-month periods with index declines including one as recently as 2013.
